intro: Melodorum vietnamense, commonly known as Vietnamese melody vine, is a climbing plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its trailing stems and opposite, ovate leaves. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. Its fruits are small berries that turn red when mature, attracting various bird species. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens, though it can be invasive in certain regions.
